title: Lord of the Rings:
content:
I am now finnally releasing a demo of my Lord of the Rings mod, starring Legolas. It has no sprites, just a charecter test of legolas, a few enviroments, and the 4 ship parts... the Shards of Narsil:

Basic story outline: Legolas is ordered by Elrond to gather the 4 shards of Narsil, but meets up with orcs, and trolls. You must find those shards.

It will get better... but here it is:

[url=http://www.freewebs.com/najawa/Lotr.zip]www.freewebs.com/najawa/Lotr.zip[/url]

Muahahaha!!!

BTW - This is a 1 lvl preveiw; it should take les than 2 minutes to look at.

-- NAJAWA --

(grr... if it doesn't work, right click, and choose "save target as")

title: Re: Darn...
content:
Photobucket? Saving screenshots is one thing you *can* use MSPaint for. Just press the Printscreen key in the game and then go paste it in Paint. It usually works.

And for the benefit of others, here are some screenshots.

[img]http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/narsil1.png[/img] [img]http://www.shikadi.net/pckf/narsil2.png[/img]

It's a good start, but usually you should do a bit more than this before you get others to download it - at least one complete level anyway.

title: Keen 4 Grass:
content:
Would anybody think less of my mod if I ripped the grass, and soil form K4? It actually looks quite nice in my mod.

-- NAJAWA --

title: hehe
content:
KeenRush: about the swapping perspectives... I did that a lot in XkyKeen2--check out the beginning of the "Enemy" level, or the start of "Jump." :-) Nobody said anything about it 2 years ago when it was released--you guys are getting picky!

I thought the main character's feet were a little big--or his head was a tad small... but it looks nice either way.

Don't be afraid to rip graphics--if you put it together into a fun enough package, nobody will mind. And don't be afraid to experiment with changing the look of things, either. :-) It never hurt to make the grass thicker, thinner, a different color, or spottier.

I will have a single prospective, because it's cool, and I like it. I will murder anybody who doesn't [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-bloody.gif[/img] (kidding).

I'm glad you all like it. I will make it a lot better. I'm also graphing out sprites in my spare time on graph paper (I get perfect pixels across the whole drawing, and can therefore copy my designs).

title: Najawa's DosBox 0.61 step by step:
content:
*sighs*

Okay; here's what ya do... *takes deep breeth*

1) Download DosBox 0.061

2) Install DosBox 0.61

3) When done, open up your start menu, and copy these two files:
a) DOSBox.exe
b) DOSBox.conf

4) Paste them into the directory which contains the program you wish to open.

5) Drag your program onto the DOSBox.exe Icon.

6) Your program should load

BTW - THIS DOES NOT WORK WITH MODKEEN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

For ModKeen:

1) Put it into your Keen directory

2) (I'm using Windows XP for example): Open up your start menu, and choose 'run'

3) type in 'cmd' (Now you have a Command Prompt)

4) Change you directory to your Modkeen directory:
(e.g. "cd C:\Modkeen" - Now you are in the folder C:\Modkeen. If you want a different folder, go up to the level where your folder is an icon. open the 'run' diolouge box in the start menu, and drag the icon of your folder onto the run box. It will give you the path to your folder. [remove the - ""])

5) Type, "modkeen -episode=1 -export"

6) Press enter

7) Now modkeen should copy the graphics from keen into the folder

8 ) Now, you can edit these pictures. When you are done, repeate the proscess, and instead type, "modkeen -episode=1 -import"


Or... *gasps for breath!!!*:

1) Go to your start menu, and choose:
a)Programs
b)Accesories
c)Notepad

2) Enter, "modkeen -episode=1 -export"

3) Choose "Save As"

4) When you are in the save box, go to the Modkeen folder, and save as "Import.bat"

5) Go to your Modkeen folder, and click on the batch file (Import.bat)

6) Now the graphics should be copyed

7) Right click on the 'Import.bat' and choose 'edit'

8 ) change the text to, "modkeen -episode=1 -import"

9) Save

10) Now, whenever you want to import, and test your new graphics, double-click on the 'Import.bat"

That's what I use.

Now I'm tired of typing, and will end this post... [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-yawn.gif[/img] ... Huh... er... Oh, yeah:

-- NAJAWA --

title: Re: Najawa's DosBox 0.61 step by step:
content: great idea for a mod!

title: Re: game
content:
Ah... the innocence... I can't stand it!!!

Lol!!!

No; have you ever played Keen 1?

([img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-lol.gif[/img] )

Yeah... That was a mod. A mod is where you take a game, and change the graphics, and lvls, and patch it a bit to your liking...

That was a Keen Mod, and thus in the Keen Forums, and not in the Miscellaneous forum.

Lol; welcome to the forums, dude... BTW - have any questions? Before you kinda ask for us to laugh at you, IM me; you bro has my IM if you care.
